title: Particle Motion - crossing an axis time

content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the position of a particle at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is given by the parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. If <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals t cubed minus 3 t squared minus t plus 1"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals t squared minus 2 t plus 1"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math>, at which of the following times <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> does the particle intersect the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis?

choices.label: <math alttext="t equals negative 0.675"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>0.675</mn></math>, <math alttext="t equals 0.461"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.461</mn></math>, and <math alttext="t equals 3.214"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.214</mn></math>

<math alttext="t equals 0"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, <math alttext="t equals 0.268"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.268</mn></math>, and <math alttext="t equals 3.732"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.732</mn></math>
There are no such times <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> that the particle intersects the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
